p: Six major genotypes of HCV have been defined with greater than 50 subtypes. Genotype 1 is most common (60â€“70 %) in the USA and Europe; genotypes 2 and 3 are less common in these areas, while genotypes 4, 5, and 6 are rare. Genotype 3 is most common in India, the Far East, and Australia. Genotype 4 is most common in Africa and the Middle East and genotype 5 is most common in South Africa. Genotype 6 is common in Hong Kong, Vietnam, and Australia. The most common subtypes are 1a, 1b, 2a, and 2b.
